title: iQOO Z10x pops up on Geekbench with key specs
description: iQOO will launch the Z10 on April 11, but it's also expected to unveil the Z10x soon. There's no word from iQOO about the Z10x yet; however, a device with model code I2404, said to be the Z10x, has popped up on Geekbench with its key specs. The device scored 1,008 and 2,878 points in Geekbench's single and multi-core tests, respectively. It has 8GB RAM onboard and runs Android 15, likely with Funtouch OS 15 on top. Powering the device is an octa-core processor with four cores clocked at 2 GHz and four cores with a maximum frequency of 2.5 GHz. This could be the Dimensity 7300 SoC, which...
excerpt: The Z10 will be launched on April 11. iQOO will launch the Z10 on April 11, but it's also expected to unveil the Z10x soon. There's no word from iQOO about...
text: iQOO will launch the Z10 on April 11, but it's also expected to unveil the Z10x soon. There's no word from iQOO about the Z10x yet; however, a device with model code I2404, said to be the Z10x, has popped up on Geekbench with its key specs. The device scored 1,008 and 2,878 points in Geekbench's single and multi-core tests, respectively. It has 8GB RAM onboard and runs Android 15, likely with Funtouch OS 15 on top. Powering the device is an octa-core processor with four cores clocked at 2 GHz and four cores with a maximum frequency of 2.5 GHz. This could be the Dimensity 7300 SoC, which comes with the Mali-G615 MC2 GPU. Geekbench doesn't reveal anything else about the Z10x, but we know what the Z10 will come with. iQOO has confirmed the Z10 will be powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 SoC, feature a quad-curved display with 5,000 nits peak brightness, and pack a 7,300 mAh battery with 90W charging support. The iQOO Z10 will be sold in Stellar Black and Glacier Silver colors. Source
html:
iQOO will launch the Z10 on April 11, but it's also expected to unveil the Z10x soon. There's no word from iQOO about the Z10x yet; however, a device with model code I2404, said to be the Z10x, has popped up on Geekbench with its key specs.

The device scored 1,008 and 2,878 points in Geekbench's single and multi-core tests, respectively. It has 8GB RAM onboard and runs Android 15, likely with Funtouch OS 15 on top. Powering the device is an octa-core processor with four cores clocked at 2 GHz and four cores with a maximum frequency of 2.5 GHz. This could be the Dimensity 7300 SoC, which comes with the Mali-G615 MC2 GPU.

Geekbench doesn't reveal anything else about the Z10x, but we know what the Z10 will come with. iQOO has confirmed the Z10 will be powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 SoC, feature a quad-curved display with 5,000 nits peak brightness, and pack a 7,300 mAh battery with 90W charging support. The iQOO Z10 will be sold in Stellar Black and Glacier Silver colors.

Source
